creditcardstep.faq.billedtrialquestion: Will I be billed during the trial?
creditcardstep.faq.billedtrialreply: No! You will be charged at the end of your 14-day trial period if you choose not to cancel it earlier. We will send you an email reminder before the end of the trial period.
creditcardstep.faq.duringtrialquestion: Can I cancel my subscription during the trial?
creditcardstep.faq.duringtrialreply: Sure! You can cancel your subscription at any time, just go to your payments page and cancel it.
creditcardstep.faq.changeplansreply: Of course! You can change plans or switch between 1/3/6/12 months billing via your account settings.

word.custom.domains.tooltip: Custom domains for active subaccounts and the main account
smartmap.description:
Our Smart Maps are based on AI and like heatmaps with eye tracking they predict which areas of visuals will receive the most attention and which areas will be viewed the least.

Our Smart Map does not require data collection as the AI ‚Äã‚Äãalgorithm uses pre-recorded data from actual tracking studies to cover a total of 30,800 images and generate an observation heatmap in just seconds. It is a much faster and cheaper option with an accuracy of 90-94%.
smartmap.alert.info: The analysis generates a predicted score that is based on the analysis of hundreds of other landing page designs and images, using artificial intelligence. Actual response of the users may differ from these results. The data relate to the design only, it does not cover the substantive content.
word.transperancy-score.tooltip: <par>The Clarity Score describes how clear and accessible the interface is to a new user.</par> <par>The score indicates the predicted response of the users to the design.</par>
transperancy.alert.info: How can I improve my score? The AI algorithm looks at the amount of information that is included in the screenshots of your design ‚Äì the volume, size and contrast of the text, the color scheme of the elements (such as the color of the CTA), the number and size of the images. A poor score indicates that the design is disorganized and essential elements are not visible enough.
smartmap.transperancy.alert.warning.head: How can I improve my score?
smartmap.transperancy.alert.warning: The AI algorithm looks at the amount of information that is included in the screenshots of your design ‚Äì the volume, size and contrast of the text, the color scheme of the elements (such as the color of the CTA), the number and size of the images. A poor score indicates that the design is disorganized and essential elements are not visible enough.
smartmap.transperancy.alert.warning.poor: Your landing page needs improvement. Check what you can change to increase clarity and attract the visitors attention. The artificial intelligence algorithm takes into account the amount of information that is contained in the screenshots of your project - text volume, size and contrast, color of elements (e.g. CTA color), number and size of images. A poor score indicates that the design is chaotic and that important elements are not visible enough.
word.peter.ranking.tooltip: Ranking of your site compared to TOP 170 Peter sites in the 'Landing Page; category
word.percentattention.tooltip: <par>AI predicts how much attention the highlighted element or area will get compared to the whole screenshot. It provides quantitative data (percentage) of specific areas and elements that were viewed most often and least often.</par><par>Adjust the color, size or layout to get better results.</par>

tour.pageinsider.step1.content: Remember to run an analysis for the main page as well as the thank you page.
tour.pageinsider.step2.content: This is the Clarity Score estimated by AI. The results predict how designs will be perceived by the users.A score between 58 and 100 predicts that the page is user-friendly.A score below 58 indicates that you still have some work to do. Try to work with the arrangement of the elements, their size or color.
tour.pageinsider.step3.content: Here you will find the Eye-tracking Heatmap and Areas of Interest of selected elements, expressed as Percentage of Attention. Use the toggle to select which data to display.Remember: the data relate to the design only, it does not cover the substantive content.

lh.first-contentful-paint.label: First Contentful Paint
lh.first-contentful-paint.description: First Contentful Paint marks the time at which the first text or image is painted.
lh.hreflang.label: Document has a valid `hreflang`
lh.hreflang.description: hreflang links tell search engines what version of a page they should list in search results for a given language or region.
lh.link-text.label: Links have descriptive text
lh.link-text.description: Descriptive link text helps search engines understand your content.
lh.font-size.label: Document uses legible font sizes
lh.font-size.description: Font sizes less than 12px are too small to be legible and require mobile visitors to ‚Äúpinch to zoom‚Äù in order to read. Strive to have >60% of page text ‚â•12px.
lh.document-title.label: Document has a `<title>` element
lh.document-title.description: The title gives screen reader users an overview of the page, and search engine users rely on it heavily to determine if a page is relevant to their search.
lh.image-aspect-ratio.label: Displays images with correct aspect ratio
lh.image-aspect-ratio.description: Image display dimensions should match natural aspect ratio.
lh.first-cpu-idle.label: First CPU Idle
lh.first-cpu-idle.description: First CPU Idle marks the first time at which the page's main thread is quiet enough to handle input.
lh.speed-index.label: Speed Index
lh.speed-index.description: Speed Index shows how quickly the contents of a page are visibly populated.
lh.bootup-speed.label: JavaScript execution time
lh.bootup-speed.description: Consider reducing the time spent parsing, compiling, and executing JS. You may find delivering smaller JS payloads helps with this.

In the list of records, locate the A record and edit it. Copy and paste the following values:
In the list of records, locate the CNAME record with the www value and edit it. If you don't have this CNAME record, add a new one. Copy and paste the following values:

empty.list.message.landings.title: Build landing pages without programming or coding skills!
empty.list.message.landings.message: Choose from our 300 templates or customize them, and put them all over the web.
empty.list.message.landings.subtitle: Only 5 steps and you're ready to go!
empty.list.message.landings.section1.mes: Browse through over 300 ready-to-use landing page templates. Specify your industry and campaign goal and we'll help you choose the perfect template. Got your own idea? Start with a blank template.
empty.list.message.landings.section2.mes: Write your own copy, upload images, videos and icons. On the left side you will find a list of widgets ‚Äì drag and drop them anywhere you want. Set your own rules and customize each element.
empty.list.message.landings.section3.mes: A form is the key ‚Äì to success ‚Äì of almost every landing page. Decide what information you need to reach your marketing goal. Remember, no one likes long and too engaging forms. Keep it smooth and effortless for the user. Add a well-thought button and integrate the form with external platforms.
empty.list.message.landings.section4.tit: Thank-you page and a mobile view
empty.list.message.landings.section4.mes: A thank-you page is the perfect way to say thank you ‚Ä¶ or to lead the visitors to another landing page. This is called a funnel. Make sure that your landing page looks well on mobile devices ‚Äì it should be accessible for the visitors anytime and anywhere.
empty.list.message.landings.section5.mes: You‚Äôre almost there! Hit that ‚ÄúPublish‚Äù button and take your time to verify your page on our test domain. When you‚Äôre ready, assign your own domain or publish the page with WordPress or Shopify.
empty.list.message.landings.bottom.title: Learn the basics. Visit our website with short video tutorials.
empty.list.message.landings.bottom.messa: Our awesome team will guide you through the whole platform and the editor.
Scroll down. In the All Products and Services section, find your domain and click on DNS.

modal.unsubscribing.delete.accout.messag: We are sorry to see you go. Give us some feedback so we can improve.
modal.unsubscribing.delete.accout.reason: 1. Why made you quit using Landingi?

modal.domains.faq.title.1: What are root domains and subdomains?
modal.domains.faq.content.1:
This is an example of a root domain: mycompany.com

A root domain consists of a second-level domain, a dot, and a top-level domain such as .com or .org. When you buy a domain name, you get something like domain.com, name.org, etc. You can only add subdomains in our platform.

You buy a domain name once, and usually, you can create an unlimited number of subdomains in your domain registrar‚Äôs account.

This is an example of a subdomain: home.mycompany.com

A subdomain is an add-on to your domain name, such as portfolio.mysite.com or www.mysite.com. You redirect the subdomain via CNAME records (CNAME and A for a www subdomain). This makes it possible to install an SSL certificate on your subdomain.
modal.domains.faq.title.2: Why can't I redirect a root domain?
modal.domains.faq.content.2:
Your landing page will display correctly only if you redirect your domain via the CNAME record. This will allow the page to load quickly and smoothly, even in the case of increased traffic. Since DNS servers do not enable redirecting root domains with the CNAME record, we do not currently support landing pages directly under root domains such as domain.com.

Instead, you can use a subdomain such as www.domain.com, deals.domain.com, or any other subdomain name.
modal.domains.faq.title.3: Can I add a path to my URL?
modal.domains.faq.content.3:
This is an example of a subdomain with a path: home.mycompany.com/events

You can publish your landing page under a subdomain with a subfolder (a path). The URL will look like something like this: {br} myportfolio.mywebsite.com/voucher, {br} myportfolio.mywebsite.com/limitedoffer, {br} myportfolio.mywebsite.com/event.

You can add a path only when you publish your landing page.

Landing pages published under an URL with a path are not counted as a new subdomain.
modal.domains.faq.content.4:
You use DNS records to modify information about the domain and redirect individual subdomains to external web servers. You‚Äôll find the DNS zone in the management panel of your domain provider‚Äôs account.

To redirect domains, you need to add/edit CNAME and A records.

CNAME record

The CNAME stands for Canonical Name and you will need this to add and then redirect a subdomain, such as voucher.domain.com or info.name.org.

A record

The A record is simply an address and indicates the IP address (IPv4 ) of your domain. That‚Äôs why the A record is always a string of digits, such as 174.129.25.170. The only time you will need to change the A record, is when you want to redirect a www subdomain.
modal.domains.faq.title.5: Will my landing pages and my data be secure? Do I need my own SSL certificate?
modal.domains.faq.content.5:
You don‚Äôt need your own SSL certificate. A free Let's Encrypt SSL certificate will be automatically installed for your subdomain when you add it to your account and redirect the DNS records. This certificate keeps your data secure.

In case you have your own SSL certificate and want to install it for your subdomain, please contact our Support and we‚Äôll add it for you.
